5xZBZ1a8YKtANGd8wTbfFA.text: Superb place. Charming furnishings - really cozy and sophisticated. Cuisine was superb - yet unfortunately steeply-priced. Mandatory for the next moment you're in that part of the area. They have now made me a regular customer and also a dedicated fan. Continue the great work.

CEPJy2IHaZCwnRogskYBGw.text: Went here with my boyfriend after wine tasting at Vinopolis and it was a fantastic evening. Had shared a decent bottle of rouge Sancerre with him once before on a summers evening on one of the barrels outside when we first started dating and it was great to come back for dinner. Great location next to Borough Market, probably better in the summer months as people spill on to the streets and there is a good drinking yard next door for some drinks first. The fish market atmosphere was great and I think it would be good to get a seat around the bar although are table was good. The service was among the best we've experienced and the food was delicious and good fun if you are willing to roll up your sleeves and get a bit mucky cracking crabs and peeling king prawns, otherwise there are plenty of things on the menu "ready to eat" - a pre-requisite really is to like fish though and preferably good wine or Guiness too.

rEmXZr0zjg2bTGRLWAUB3A.text: a spirited, bustling establishment perfectly placed in the busy Borough Market. Service can be a bit hit or miss given how packed the place gets, but the oysters and fish is super fresh and they have excellent wines to compliment. if you are looking for something other than shellfish/seafood, it seems that this would not be the optimal choice given other tasty options a stone's throw away.

p9WZUXa2tQX3QMHX5RbPCA.text: Oysters. great. Sparkling wine. awesome. guinness pot pie. bland!!! what happen there?!?!

LxpDR3VXvGgL6X4aDyxejQ.text: I stopped in here after perusing Borough Market for some oysters and a glass of prosecco. The oysters were good, albeit a bit pricey.Later, came back for my dinner reservations, and we had several dishes, but by far the best was the steak, Guinness and oyster pie. A delicious steak pie with tender bits of beef and two raw oysters on the side. You slide the oysters into your pie and steam it for a while.. Absolutely decadent.

-di4_PwZkyRRtvQgACEVig.text: i walked in after eating my way through borough market.  i got to talking with the guy behind the bar about the oysters they carried and after spending 10 minutes asking him questions i decided to try a mixed dozen of different varieties.  of course the oysters were awesome.  i had the carlingford (creamy with a mild taste), dorset (mild, light finish, crisp and very briney-  bitter-beer face briney and SO good), and maldon (minerally, bold meat flavor and corresponding texture).  the part of the experience that will stay with me is not how great the oysters were but how great the level of service was-  i walked in off the street during lunch service and the staff took time to answer my questions thoroughly.  definitely hope to be back.

iAaEVGQAV0tgh11CYWvUGQ.text: All i have to say is MAKE RESERVATIONS because it is tiny, delicious, and everyone knows it!My life has forever changed since Beef and Oyster Pie!!!  Unbelievably tasty, although a huge portion.  Perhaps share with a friend?Do not bring your vegetarian friends here.  They will suffer. The chef scoffed at my friend's attempt to find a vegetarian meal.  Bring your lovers of mollusks!!!  For they will rejoice!Atmosphere is...well, tiny and quaint.  You are there for the food!

CrSdR8YDz0RUZx-78Lleyw.text: Landed there for a surprise birthday party and must say it lived up to it's good reputation! The seafood was the most fresh tasting  I have had in London. We started with a medley of oysters, brown shrimp and whelks followed by mains which ranged from John dory, sole, crab and scallops! Everyone was very happy with their food. My only criticism for the evening was the slow service, I had to get up several times to request them especially to hurry up. It is quite pricey the bill came to an average 70 per head with a few drinks each.

JaLT_paxn4nDOLKHTdSJ0A.text: I absolutely love this place. So what if we're all a little bored of the rustic shabby chic thing? It absolutely works here, with the weather board and tin lamps and vintage lettering and the old barrels and concrete floors and cast iron fixtures. It gets really busy and that bustle is what makes a place like this, along with the extensive and well chosen wine list, the open-plan kitchen with worn-leather bar stools you can sit at and watch the chef blazing at the grill and oven while the commis cracks on beside him, shucking and shelling and blanching and braising. My recommendation is for the gloriously fresh rock oysters with a glass of Picpoul de Pinet, followed by the beef, Guiness and oyster pie accompanied by a glass of hearty Rioja. If your toes aren't curling by then, you've probably been decapitated, which is ironic as that pie is in fact to die for. Bash in to the crust and sample the rich deep flavours of the meat and porter, then place your unctuous oyster delicately inside, where the salty brine will mix to create a heady combination of light and dark. This is comfort food at it's finest. I'm going all out and giving it five because the prices are reasonable and it's entirely consistent. Yet to check out their Soho sister but there's always room for a few more oysters.

ywpClcKPTOounbWwUMtBnQ.text: This place is a must for oyster lovers. Nice short menu on the blackboard featuring a well focused range of fresh as you like fish dishes with an excellent selection of oysters. For those that don't like em raw there are 3 or 4 cooked oyster choices. It's a cosy, some may say squashed, layout with long sharing tables and stools around the bar. Price wise it's not cheap but in my opinion well worth it. Will not be to eveyones taste but I'm happy to try to visit once a week - enough said??

Puj4naEtXV_U9WfxS7ljVg.text: I'm not the world's biggest fan of oysters. I love seafood but oysters have never really been my thing. I was forced into going here by my boyfriend who *loves* the little things and I love food so did want to make a go of trying them here.I actually didn't mind the oysters here at all, this is what Wright Brothers do best after all right? They were certainly fresh, tasted like they came straight from the sea and my boyfriend was audibly excited by the whole experience - he loved it.You can eat other things here too but I found the menu a little over priced. It was pretty bustling which adds to the good vibes of Borough Market and the surrounding area.It's not the best seafood place I've been to, I prefer a little more variety but they've raised my opinion of oysters ever so slightly...

i4iNXPdH5wnwyv9pJYElMQ.text: Love it here! The oysters and red wine..sublime!

abpklnOeMhmODYYYCeI0OQ.text: I really don't understand some of the negative reviews here. Yes, it's pricey. Quality seafood is pricey. The days of poor people eating oysters plucked out of the Thames mud are well-receded into the distant past. So are the days of people not infrequently dying or getting very, very ill eating bad seafood. Plus, if you read the papers you might know that there is a problem with some of the Mediterranean oyster beds which has resulted in prices being driven up.But if you compare the prices here against other places in London selling high-quality seafood, you won't find them out of line (not too big a surprise, a lot of them are serving seafood they bought from the Wright Brothers wholesale operation). If anything the prices here at the source might be a bit less.I have eaten here at least four times now, and have only once made a reservation. If you are okay to sit at the bar, and don't mind having a time limit on your meal, there are times when you can just drop in. I have always found them staff pleasant, friendly, and at times charming.The oysters are always very fresh and tasty. I've tried some of their cooked oyster specials, and have been quite pleased with those as well. The smoked fish pate is fabulous. Everything is very fresh. The beer selection is interesting, definitely recommend the Hix Oyster Ale.This is one of my personal favorite restaurants in London!

SFB3_h3d9lrMNg4vbCOEQg.text: Fantastic food, great location.  The oysters wre so fresh and the wait staff incredibly knowledgeable.

c6ufxq3yfjWkrKEcuOu0vQ.text: Oysters were great (a bit over-priced), but the service there is HORRIFIC! The bartenders are nice but was is up with the waitresses? So rude, bitchy and unfriendly (especially the brunette). Not worth the trip unless you like being talked down to. Horrible service.

CPe1WtFG4eBex4u_jgu6cg.text: I loved this place.  After I read up on the oyster spots in London, my partner decided to make a reservation for my bday.  The oysters were fab!  The plate of rocks was a great way to sample their selection.  We really enjoyed the mix of different varieties.  I was keeping one shell over on the side as a little memento and the waiter caught me and offered to scrub it and cling wrap it so we could add it to the collection.For our main we both had the full crab, which at £12.75 for a large crab seemed like a good deal to me.  I made such a mess devouring it, and the waiter was super cool about it.  What can I say?  It was a battle! The dessert menu was a little light, but after all the salty oysters and crab, I needed something sweet to finish off the meal.  I had truffles and he had creme brulee, both which did the job.  All in all, for 12 oysters, 2 crabs, a bottle of wine, and dessert for both, the bill was quite reasonable.  The service was fantastic (super friendly bearded Kiwi) and I will definitely return.

QjSocJ6kd6V8A8dN8SuG4A.text: Absolutely love this restaurant. I frequently travel to London with work and this is a great place to go either alone or in a group for a relaxed meal. The seafood is of exceptional quality and cooked to perfection. While the food isn't cheap (although it's perfectly possible to have an inexpensive meal through choosing dishes such as mussels) the drinks menu to accompany is good quality and for London, good value. My favourates includes they're Oysters Rockerfeller, mussels, razor clams & for drinks their very reasonably priced but very drinkable Prosecco. The only reasons I haven't given this 5 stars are: - A more extensive choice of sides would be a bonus as portions aren't huge- Selfish, but I'd love to come here more often. Sadly it's difficult if even one person in the party doesn't eat shellfish as the other options are fairly limited. Nonetheless, it's one of my favourite London restaurants and I look forward to returning in the New Year. Top tip if you're thinking of going - book in advance, because this place is popular.

cZwzNqj8WfePYYlUBGDBFQ.text: Great place to grab a guinness and a dozen oysters....a bit pricey though

q32NeG6r_8eeQc__jtxqbQ.text: Oh no. I would not recommend this place. It's way too pricey for low quality seafood.  The service was prompt and courteous but the food was poor. Oh, I saw what other people had and in my opinion it wasn't any better than what I got, the crab. which was awful. I left hungry and disappointed.

3ROPqqziTkgjeudJA42fAQ.text: One of my current faves in the area. Never fails to impress me. Great food and ok/wack service.

8TNbIi04W4xEuAmFaKWIzg.text: Wright Brothers: instant love. Love for fish, love for seafood, love for oysters. You got to luuuuuuuurve the oysters. Oysters and porter - this place is a temple to the humble bivalve. Here you can have more than a dozen kinds of porter, ale and stout, and an oyster menu ranging from Wild Colchesters to Carlingford Loughs, Cumbrae and Lindisfarne oysters. If you want fish or other seafood, they do beautiful catch of the day, such as plaice or mackerel, or the classic English pint of prawns with a lovely, fluffy mayonnaise. I could spend an entire afternoon here eating this stuff and laughing heartily. This is one of London's finest, most inspired, most inspiring oyster bars. Probably the best.

_rZE-W5kiyO1Lx0FWr7WcA.text: It's a bit on the small side inside but the food was really good, it made up for the fact that I was perched on a stool throughout my lunch. Starters was potted shrimp and mains was fish pie, very delicious and maybe a little on the pricey side but a nice treat.

vwtmwMuazHtBcLQ8Do9vYA.text: Really nice staff here n great atmosphere! They've got fresher oyster than harrods oyster bar:-)

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

tbilrT9V07PceYEm0dfugQ.text: We ordered crab, chips and a bottle of wine. I was surprised that the crab is served cold, I didn't like that, but the taste was good. The sauce was just some mayo, a bit disappointing. I had some apple crumble for dessert, very good. Don't think I'm gonna go back though, too expensive and I wasn't impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Cold crab

gXp8zfvymAS_Xr7X-nD-2g.text: One of the best meals I've had in London, and definitely worth repeating.The full name of the restaurant is Wright Brothers Oyster and Porter House, so I dutifully ordered a porter (St. Peter's Old-Style, from the broad selection available) and three "Japanese oysters" (from the specials board, which had four options in addition to the regular menu items). The oysters, albeit a bit pricey at £3 apiece, were exceptional (I'd pay the £9 again!).I sat at the counter overlooking the kitchen, so asked one of the chefs for a recommendation from the specials (I assume daily picks from the market), and he recommended the hake. It was perfectly prepared and accompanied by a sauce perfectly matched to the hake (an all-too-rare occurrence) and vegetables that supported the fish well.Dessert options were few, but with little room left, the cheese plate was just perfect.The host was polite and friendly. The wait staff were efficient and engaging, and happy too to help with recommendations. All in all, a standout meal.Price for oysters, fish, one porter, and cheese was £50.

PcBqOoL7ZNOPK3U_WubMqQ.text: While I haven't been in the actual restaurant, I've been to the pop-up Shuckshuck Oyster bar which the Wright Brothers have set up next door to the restaurant. The oysters were fresh and delicious, and the service was really great. Not only did the man serving us check that we had eaten oysters before/knew what we were doing, he offered us particularly pungent, tasty oysters as we were seasoned oyster eaters (which was a real treat), and said that he makes an effort to offer more delicately flavoured ones to those trying for the first time - what attentive customer service!

vZJ_0cL84PaXa-jovz9daA.text: My wife and i had a great experience here because it was a special night for us, but the food was so-so.We were very excited to have some razor clams, but it was very disappointing. We were expecting fresh and simply cooked razor clams drizzled with some olive oil but these were desecrated. It was all chopped up and mixed with some random vegetables. The same goes for the octopus carpaccio, drowned in truffle oil. It was nauseating. Just let the seafood speak for itself!The oysters were very good, but very expensive.Service was great as it is at this price range.

KRVRzRoXXknBRz_-OnpB1A.text: Excellent in every way. From the cold Guiness to the Japanese inspired and New Orleans fried oysters to the roasted hake. All superb.  The waitstaff were helpful and charming.  The atmosphere is comfortable and encourages repeat visits. Highly recommended.

Y0GNWXmI3uc7NInQomNJGQ.text: Yes. Anyone who is crazy about seafood, anyone who wants to have a kick of omega 3 and anyone who has doubts seafood being good - I request to go to Wright Brothers. Fresh seafood, fresh catch of seasonal fish, great bar setting - what else is there to wish for?I went there on a sunny Friday afternoon for a lazy lunch. It was as crowded as it gets - my lunch partner and I sat at the bar and watched the food being prepared. Although all cooked food looked amazing - for over 27C outside we went for the seafood platter (fruits the mer).Buzzing Borough market is nearby so you can pop by before or after you've done your weekly produce shopping on a weekend, or have a long lunch on a Friday afternoon with a cheeky glass of wine as well. I ordered great honey sweet Rose on the menu - cannot remember the name, but I highly recommend asking the waiter for what would go well with that particular dish you're ordering.Dipping the fingers in the platter full of ice and having a competition of who would get the snail out first, was fun. I'm coming back to savour the fish that looked fabulously prepared and discover other gems in their wine list!P.S. Reason for being stingy and not giving 5 out of 5 - is that the crab was really missing from the seafood platter.

4pAfnlq4oUHsODV0PissKQ.text: I would say I of the best London restaurants in soho. Food was delicious and atmosphere was great. We had the whole fish for 2 and drinks. Fish was perfectly prepared!

QJgpOSVDuQY-59LDSM2BWA.text: Good: friendly, helpful staff, nice atmosphere, noise from talkative eaters and not tasteless blaring muzick.Poor: the food!  Fish soup much, much too vinegary. Plaice had half the top layer with excess salt, rest of it quite tasteless (not fresh enough?).  Fish pie eh!, good salmon bits, mediocre thick potato crust.  Nice bread.Beer okay, wine poor.  Didn't have any shellfish, so I've tempered my negative reaction to 2 stars...otherwise, one star might be accurate.Conclusion:  overpriced trendy hotspot, not worth it.

_NRQrSZ5Qt8ecxYcgPod1g.text: Oysters are to me little balls of spit that some very clever business man has managed to market as one of the worlds most expensive delicacies. Every now and then I torture myself by trying one again and I'm immediately reminded at how repulsive they are. If these are my feelings towards oyster's you might be wondering why I visited an oyster house recently. It is an odd pairing I'll admit but being a great fish lover I was hoping they would have something else on the menu that would tempt me. Sadly, I was disappointed. As you might expect oysters are really the star of the show at Wright Brothers Oyster House. They come in a selection of sizes with a selection of accompaniments and pictures of the things adorn the walls. My family quickly tucked in to these beasts and raved about how great they were. Clearly if you like oysters, this is the smart place to come. However, as I stirred my watery and tasteless crab and coconut soup, I couldn't help feeling left out. These patchy standards continued throughout the meal and although everyone enjoyed the beef and oyster pie (even me), the mussels were a bit disappointing. We also found the service a bit snobby. The waiter seemed particularly annoyed when we asked for tap water which did little to make us feel at home. Over the rest of the night we found it quite difficult to catch his eye and I couldn't help but feel like he had more important customers to tend to. The Oyster and Porter House is a great place to visit if you love Oysters and don't mind paying for them. Tables around were audibly excited as plate after plate of oysters went by. However, if like me, you're looking for a bit more variety to your meal Wright Brothers is not a great bet. Prices are high for quality this patchy. Unless I was accompanying a real oyster fanatic, I doubt I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

nttJ828VObEIc2nksYnj0g.text: Love this place. Right across from Borough Market. Amazing, briny, fresh oysters. Lovely staff.

i81LQfg9ZJ1siAT5XMWUlw.text: Been here probably 10 times and have enjoyed every visit. Food is full of taste. Atmosphere is vibrant and fun. Service usually good. Ok prices a bit on high side but for such a great time who will complain. Explore the menu and some 'simple' things are simply great. Will be back over and over.

0PjoNTtbXLx7zc9O85PDbg.text: Yummy.... Keeping eating two days. Recommend the oysters, crab,whelks and especially octopus with chorizo(heaven)!!!

BgYIUQG4u3lN9eKNkBrKYw.text: I was told to book in advance as this place is so popular. So, I went twice outside peak hours, i.e. 3-4 pm during weekdays, when only 2-3 guests were around. I had (i) Mordon ? oysters + glasses of sincere; and (ii) Irish oysters + glasses of Chablis. They were fresh and decently tasty. Services are friendly and efficient. Prices, ok, reasonable for this freshness in London. What is good is that they know and like the oysters. What else should we expect?

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

PSEzKx0nmHEKA-TIDFQx-w.text: After spending a lot of time and money eating my around Borough Market I think I concluded this was my favourite place to eat, or share a Guinness over a not too contrived ale barrel.It's always bursting with energy, but not unapproachably so, and has a great long bar which you can at, creating a great atmosphere that you don't see too often in London.  I've eaten the oysters there, the fish pie, the steak and ale pie etc. and all have been fantastic, I think for the price you can't do much better around there.The Guinness on tap is excellent.Highly recommended and worth waiting for a table (they'll call you if required).

HDoR_GTXJL2th5fn4QhKeQ.text: "Ooooh, it looks nice in here, but I don't like oysters." "Me neither, but look at all those people inside and warm and not eating oysters." "Let's go in, and not eat oysters, they're weird." And go in we did. And then we tried to sit at the bar. But we weren't allowed. In fact, we were sternly stopped from sitting. You see, despite half of the place being empty, we couldn't sit down unless we were eating. They had tables as well as bar stools, so it's not like everyone drinking would take up table space, and the 'drinking area' was big enough for six people. There was ten people standing in it. And no, no one was eating. Strikes me as a stupid way to run a business. If there's space, you keep people spending money. Unfortunately, we turned and left and spent our money elsewhere. I don't think I'll be back. Shame, because aside from silly rules, it's pretty in here.

cGZ3dy749Fua2xxOg3LN2g.text: This place is a killer for those who are mildly allergic to oysters.  It was extremely busy when we got here at 2pm and had a 20 minutes wait (which we spent buying olives and ham opposite).  I guess the huge popularity meant that they shucked oysters mega quickly.  Usually I can manage 6 oysters before my mouth start itching and have to stop; but here the tell tale signs started right after the first one.  Oh the woes of loving oysters when you can't really eat it.  Well the story here is that they don't wash their oysters and they are shucked very quickly and that there are shell bits in your meat.The prawns and the fried whitebaits were delicious but I'd advise staying away from the razor clams as they were pretty tasteless and my dad got a dead (as in off tasting) one.Otherwise the service is pretty hairy as they were so busy; but with (generally) tasty seafood and at such a great location, I am looking forward to my next borough market/ wright's visit.

_yuNOu4671qxjW0w27t8hQ.text: I ate there a few days ago and found it to be a really charming establishment. They offer not only oysters but also many other kinds of fish for some-one who may not be partial to oysters.I consider this to be one of the best oyster restaurants- at least in London. Did you know that oysters can be boiled,fried sauteed and even turned into a mean fritter. Not only may they good for your sex drive,but they are considered to very nutritious containing a high level of protein.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

3H3zkLyMhfPio32lhXJlsw.text: I went here last night as a type of place I'd visit on holiday but never go in my home town. The Oyster House is a pretty small restaurant just round the back of Borough Market next to a Konditor cake shop. Menus are on blackboards rather than on paper, and there's a whole menu just for the oyster selection. Seating is available towards the front on stools around barrels but the main chunk is on high stools surrounding the bar area, with two other long tables tucked around the corner. I had scallops to start (£9.99) which involves three of them attached to my plate using mashed potato (is that not odd?) grilled and with tomatoes. It was really tasty but seemed to be coated in oil so I'm not sure what it was doing for my calorie count. My companion had oysters which were presented in ice on a large dish on the bar. He says they were good! I had 1/2 grilled lobster for my main (£19.50) which was really nice but didn't involve the hard work lobster normally entails. It seems in cooking they had removed all the meat and then put it back in to make it easier to eat. Our other main course was cod which came with a small bowl of roasted new potatoes. Only salads are available to order as sides so this was an unexpected potato bonus! The total was £70 including two glasses of wine which is pretty expensive. Although I probably wouldn't return, it was a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

BqiosbUiGLneN9mDGD9Gog.text: I only had their oysters which were fantastic. Can't speak for their food or drinks.Lindinfarne, UK oyster - 6/10 - somewhat salty, butteryJersey Royale oyster - 8/10 - salty, mild flavor, cucumber aftertasteCarligford Lough, IR oyster - 9/10 - somewhat salty start followed by a mild sweet flavor with a cucumber aftertaste 9

oiPuxGi6ePo8H20SwD5tAg.text: Great seafood in a super chill ambience.  Couldn't have asked for more on a Sunday afternoon.We started with an oyster platter, then ordered a crab dish, prawns and oysters (with something-that-I-cannot-remember) pie.  The oysters were super fresh and hit the spot for me.  My prawn dish was also solid -- the best-seasoned and best-tasting steamed prawns I've ever had.  It was surprisingly filling too.  I had a small taste of the other two dishes, which both of my friends enjoyed.The staff was really friendly and patient with us as we tried to decide what we wanted. And with the semi-outdoor, chill ambience eating at the bar, I felt like I could sit there and pig out on seafood forever.Highly recommend the place en route to the amazing Borough Market!

OE29CDlMSve9F3mE4TOgWw.text: Friday nights at borough market offer a great atmosphere for anyone seeking a casual drink or a delicious meal. This week, we finally tried Wright Brothers after many nights eyeing the platters of seafood with much envy! The restaurant was fully booked, but they do hold the front tables for walk ups and drinks only. We managed to secure two seats near the front, ordered drinks and after reviewing the nights specials, settled on the potted shrimps starter, something I'd never tried. For me, it was a slightly strange texture and the flavour was a bit lacking, but it was beautifully presented. My main of the calamari with chilli, lime and ginger was a knock out success! Perfect texture, delightfully spicy and tangy, and the accompanying salad was dressed with a lovely lightly sweet dressing. My partner ordered the moules mariniere which were fantastic! The flavour of the broth was expertly infused into the mussels themselves, though the dish certainly could have benefitted from a side of bread or frites to sop up all the delicious sauce. My creme brûlée was fantastic- beautifully crisp top and smooth creamy filling. We finished our night with the best espresso martinis I've ever had, and vowed to return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Creme brulee!
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Calamari
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

PgzAGEJnAYViMOciZvCmCg.text: A beautiful setting in this Spitalfields branch. As you come in goes right around and you can go for casual seating at the bar there. Sit propped at the bar and take advantage of the happy hour that happens between 3-6pm where oysters are only £1! Awesome deal.

lfPERMp9NsorxKqlRvsw5g.text: AMAZING fresh seafood! The oyster bar cold served food was great, matched perfectly by the chef's delicious daily seafood menu. I had a great time eating by the oyster bar and seeing the food prepared. Recommend trying the large crab (the small isn't ideal for sharing!), oysters (raw!) and char grilled squid!But if you are undecided or stuck, there are plenty of friendly staff to help you and you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Crab and oyster

YKyyqYH59Js1fyOsuGQ3xQ.text: For a dining treat, Spitalfields has always represented for me. Androuet, Blixen and La Pietra are a few which has tickled my taste buds. Living and working nearby, it is inevitable that I will have a wander around the market and cater to my food craving by having a snack here. The Wright Brothers was on my list. I follow their instagram feed and love the tantalising food shots and bags of personality their posts have. In fact, I think that more and more, instagram is influencing my decision on where to dine. It isn't always easy or cost effective to book a photographer to boost your website gallery, so instagram helps cut corners in a visual, up to date and effective way. Shots that you took last year still on your food gallery pales in comparison to a quick snap on your smartphone of the special of the day on your instagram feed. I urge restauranteurs to really embrace this way of marketing. Anyway, back to the review. Wright Brothers in Spitalfields is filled with an older, smart serious crowd. It is just important that you know if you have a beard, skinny jeans and are a little more Shoreditch than city. That said, it doesn't really make a difference, as the focus here is the food. We tried it for lunch and although we had not made a reservation, we were squeezed in. One thing I must note is that it was busy, but the waitress, whilst serving a table and acknowledging another guest practically snapping their fingers for attention, nodded our way to let us know she would be with us in a sec. That kind of juggling of roles, reminds me of old school service, when the front of house team really saw this industry as a career route, as opposed to gap fillers/travelling jobs. It puts you at ease and off the bat, let's you know you are in good hands. Once we were seated with menus, we asked about a couple of dishes and she proceeded to blow our minds further by knowing exactly what was in the dish, how it was prepped and presented. We were sold. It was literally a breath of fresh air. I seldom talk about service in restaurants unless it is particularly bad, as most of the time it is just passable and not worth a mention. This was the bar for all future places I go to, to surpass. I am not holding my breath.We went for the express lunch menu which is value for money with 2 courses for £21.00 or 3 courses for £25.00. The portion sizes are not rations, you are actually left full up.For starters I had ortiz achovies, with shaved winter beets and chives. Sam (not me or the one who lives in Essex), had graceburn feta, pomelo and cashew nut salad. The speciality here is seafood, but I just wanted to quickly add that they do steak so meat lovers are not left out. For main course, it was a hefty shrimp filled burger with chips and chipotle mayo for Sam and a morel mushroom & rich wild garlic mushroom tagliatelle. Yes, it rocked. We were well chuffed with our decision to come here as the food was outstanding. During the meal, the service continued to be attentive and on point. Genuine smiles and intention to assist.I highly recommend visiting this one or any of the other locations. They have definitely got things Wright, oops sorry, right!

dQ56aIeY2-x_NuccJ2I9TA.text: Having heard good things on this restaurant from other yelpers, I booked a table for Mother's Day. We turned up and were initially not hopeful about our table, the restaurant was packed and there was a line of people trying to get in. To my shame, they were perfectly prepared, and we were soon sitting at a long table next to another party. Our waiter was great, keeping drinks topped up and answering questions on the menu. The menu though, it could be better placed. They provide the main menu on the large wall behind the bar, the oyster menu on the wall above the disabled toilets, and the specials menu above the kitchen. This meant that everyone at my table had a menu in front of them, behind them and to one side. The specials menu also had the fun of being written in a hard to read handwriting, which my parents couldn't quite make out. Cue me and my sister looking at the board, deciphering an item and then turning around to tell them before getting the next one. Not surprisingly, none of us ordered a special... or ordered oysters from the other misplaced menu. Instead we all ordered from the one menu card that had been placed on the table.Shying away from the giant platters of fruit de mer, we opted for starters and mains, fish soup, whitebait, smoked salmon, and x, followed by fish pie, dressed crab and Moules Marinier. The food was good, my crab being a good amount of crab with no bits of shell (not sure how they did it but kudos!), the mayonnaise was on the side to be added, not premixed in, which was a nice touch. Fish pie was good although there were comments that it could have done with an extra flavour/texture as opposed to being purely fish in its creamy sauce under the potato. Mussels were good, but French frite were desired but not on offer. Wine accompanying the meal was good if just a little expensive.Compared to Tapas Brindisa down the road, this wins hands down for me. The food, the service, the atmosphere, all streets ahead.

xtBQCABdHzLbwesu8T9YcQ.text: Loved this place. Really great atmosphere and real London feel to it. Had the fish soup to start which was delicious then the salmon and smoked haddock fish pie which was very tasty. Washed it all down with a great bottle of white wine. Our server was friendly and very helpful.

_ko2wU_WNExKGTKHr8ANYw.text: Just walking by while found this place. What a pleasant surprise!  Certainly there was a nice crowd so we came in for wine and seafoods.  Everything we had, mussels, shrimps and Rockefeller oysters, are very tasty!!!  So we will be back!

qiCyojfwBZUh2oVvOKZH4Q.text: I love oysters and they have a great selection, not the cheapest in the world, but never not had good fish here. Does get VERY busy after work and weekends (booking advisable).Great during the quiet periods during the day when you can have a nice chat, enjoy a porter and oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. A look across the bar

2i5dWBllgU9beOJLGLdhWA.text: Sadly I never got to taste the food.  I walked in on two separate occasions during a day of shopping around Spitalfields and after a few minutes of being completely ignored by both the staff at the raw bar and several waitresses (who only stared blankly at me), I simply turned around and left.  I absolutely cannot stand that type of apathy when there are literally hundreds of restaurants willing to work incredibly hard to welcome and serve a new potential customer.  Unfortunately Wright Brothers has lost me as a customer for life (which sucks for them as I eat out 5-10 times a week and habitually patronize the same handful of excellent restaurants around London).

8GIaNGuRygt7ukKE9Hj8jQ.text: After strolling through the market on a rainy day, we really needed a cold Guinness and some oysters. When we saw the Grand Plateau (38 pounds) on the menu, we figured it sounded more fun than just getting some oysters, and I highly recommend you do the same and order it. The plateau features all sorts of seafood that we never would of ordered on their own (crazy little cockles and periwinkles) as well as beautifully poached shrimp (head ons for sucking the juice!) and oysters. The plateau came with a lovely mayo, butter, bread, and mignonette assortment so you could have options for either having the shrimp with mayo on bread or dipping the little cockles into the mignonette.Such a fun way to laze around for a few hours and sample the fresh seafood.See attached photo of the plateau and drool.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Grand Plateau. Incredible.

zcEOZrCR6u8cSk74tpKCog.text: This place is a rip off! I would not go back here again. The portions are tiny and it's very very expensive. We ordered a plate of fried sea food and we got 3 pieces of squid 3 prawns and the rest were anchovies. The prawns still had the head and feet on then so by the time you took it all off all the batter had come off in ur hands. In addiction I got the feeling the staff were trying to push us to order a bottle of wine even though we repeatedly asked for just a glass on 3 separate occasions.

ZCEPhIreMvQnPxfyQhZ5gw.text: Sometimes when I go places, I expect to like things, not love them. This was one of those cases... after looking at the menu and hearing the fish board specials, I thought, ok, this will all be fine. In reality, everything was absolutely amazing in its own right and it was kind of surprising in the best way possible that each dish was well thought-out to be a winner and they haven't filled the menu with easy fluff choices. Do you know what I mean though, you can kind of tell when a chef has their favourites and then they just do some other things to fill some space... We had nearly everything and while I could list and recommend, the menu changes often so I don't want you to get your hopes up about anything in particular. Just get some oysters and some plates of mains to share with some friends and you'll be set. It's on the high-side of reasonable but certainly not inaccessible, you should probably book ahead if you want an actual table but if you're happy to sit at the bar and chat with your server, then see if they have an open seat.

pSGjQLNrxv-jfKsPmMMxyw.text: This was a great find today. I must confess that this was not the original choice. After being put on an indefinite wait at neighboring Brindisa, we hungry souls ambled on Stoney Street to chance upon Wright Brothers. Not sure why we never walked into this one, given our almost weekly trip to Borough Market.The limited menu was obviously indicative that we're in for the greatest and the freshest sea finds in Southwark. We weren't surprised when we saw the place packed on a cold Sunday evening.The kitchen is open and makes for a good way to get a sea food lesson or two, just watching the cooks go. This is a serious seafood place, for oysters in particular; so pretty much every other patron looked like they had or were about to write a book on fine seafood. The place was packed with people, who were all staring at the oysters written up on the blackboards.The petit platter of fruit de mer was the highlight with Prawns, clams, mussels and oysters. Alongside was a serving of mayo and red wine vinegar. Perfectly accompanied. Well thought out and tried. Fresh, fresh, fresh!On the menu, there were so many different preparations of oysters. I was in my own little oyster Disneyland. Alas - I do have a limited stomach and wallet, so I went for the Moules Mariniere, which was excellent, again, FRESH (!!!!), albeit slightly overdone on the butter. The crispy battered squid was above average.Ending the meal with the chocolate truffles is not a bad idea. One of us came back hungry; so yes - bad place to go to if you've skipped meals all day and are looking for desperate comfort food. But, other than the slightly challenged level of service, really not much to complain about.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

rua8YKJyNce-NqM53l-Qtw.text: This place is always packed, if you do not have a reservation you need to be prepared to wait for a while. But its so worth it! We where a party of six, and booked in advance as we knew it would be harder for us to get a table by just walking in. The table we was given was next to the kitchen and could enjoy seeing the food beeing prepared. Among us we tried many of the different oysters, and also a few of the main courses. All very very very good. Some of us enjoyed the natrual oysters, but my favourite was the oysters dressed with ginger, wasabi and soy sause.I also had the pint of prawns and they where really good. Our waiter was extremely nice and knew what he was talking about. Made our visit an absoulute fantastic experience.

3BlvaaXhxCzN5qD_1KGKlQ.text: I was lucky enough to be brought her when my mother visited me in London. The place is quite pricey, but this is something I would expect when good seafood and fish are served. We both ordered the sea bass that was to be served on shrimp and tarragon risotto. Unfortunately both our dishes were seriously under cooked when we received them. When we pointed this out the restaurant solved the issue very well. They apologized and asked us whether we would like the same dish redone, or whether we wanted to order something else. We decided to wait for another serving. The wait was worth it. When we got new plates the fish was cooked to perfection and they gave both of us an extra piece. The risotto worked really well with the fish as well, so we both left with smiles on our faces.

qGxELTrxuhE-HmlfUZlSNw.text: This place is a seafood restaurant that goes beyond the old deep fried. Sure you can get fish and chips but the highlights for me are the small plates and starters. My favourites were a delicious (and huge) scallop, octopus and chorizo (a must try), an amazing warm salmon egg and endive salad and a super fresh cerviche. They also have a couple of 'dressed' oysters that are really refreshingly yum. They have a special 3pm- 6pm on weekdays where they serve £1 oysters which is worth leaving work early for. Grab a spot at the bar and settle in with a bottle of bubbles or enjoy their great range of beers!

cbmRHcRRXSDhnNxRKW_HNQ.text: This is my first review but not my first visit to Wright Brothers. But I have today it's always a pleasure. The staff are friendly , helpful and knowledgeable about all of the wonderful food they serve. If you want fantastic food in a relaxed fun atmosphere this is a must stop location.

P3dD15lxETlR4j8zo4Gp-A.text: Just superb place! And a bit of a story behind this one....My brother, father and I had just left Guy's Hospital after finding out that my father unfortunately has cancer!  Shocked and saddened, to cheer ourselves up and distract us, we all agreed that 'life is too short, let's go and have a nice lunch!'  Wright Brothers provided the perfect venue.Dad had Whitebait to start. I shared a selection of Rock Oysters with my brother.  Then Dad and I had a small Moules Marinière pot each, and my brother had Smoked Salmon. Served with delicious fresh bread and butter.  Of course we tried each other's dishes.... thumbs up all around!The wine list was extensive.... and in the mindset of 'life is too short', we ordered a bottle of Puligny Montrachet 1er Cru AOC which was an amazing wine and went down a treat with our seafood delights!The restaurant location, décor and atmosphere is fantastic and the incredibly friendly, polite staff topped off a very special, albeit emotionally fuelled lunch.I will definitely return here!

YWW4zuF-6kuwSEoh1LQzYA.text: The menu is rather sparse, vaguely traditional and choice of oysters include the likes of The Rockefeller, a wasabi/ginger/soy combo (a bit too Pret for me) and a variety of tabascos is on the table. If oysters interest you, great, but there's not a lot of choice of anything else. Hunger panicked me.I had previously been hot-desking with my colleague, so a dinner date preluded by a stroll along the misty Thames prepared us for an inspired pescatarian plate. *Gasps* one of my favourites, The Table was closed!  My evening, I thought adjourned. But wait! Watson, I cried, in Borough Market there's a cornucopia of choice. Oysters and porter,  good choice Watson. The Wright Bros. know a thing or two about Oysters, but the weak porter on offer was worse than a wet weekend in 'Whitstable', overwhelmingly worrying while we waited for our waiter to wait on my indecision of what to have on his 3rd squeeze between the packed canteen seating to get to us. As I anxiously scanned the menu for mains, what appeared as a jovial bustling environment on being seated was actually claustrophobically distracting my decision making, full of boorish loud braggarts.The waiter, abated and educated me on oysters (I love to learn about the provenance on my plate, but theres no point in explaining your epiphany on the French-chewable, full of flavour, but out-of-season ones, is there?) We slurped and bit lip-lickingly through a selection of oysters deliciously displayed, served  with tantalising shallot vinegar; smaller Jersey's were delicate and sweet as described, whilst Devon's were big bold, meaty mineraley morsels.   On ordering mains, the waiters enthusiasm became borderline intrusive, perhaps due to the tightly packed seating, I was put off the idea of their Sardines and d'not slyly market me sides after you inform me theres a  25-30 wait mins for a fish pie.Something in between? No! You can cram too many people into a small space, but I will not be cramming extras around the little room I have and if this epic wait for a fish pie means if it is anywhere near overdone; Mary heck will break loose. I began practicing my tirade, in my head. Sorry, I was still  'Hangry'. The chef's artistic expression of a fish pie prettily piped with fluffy potato, thank Gouda, was not overcooked. But if this was the reason for the wait; if I'd have wanted to see Mondrianic angles I've have gone to the Tate, but with this Po-Tate I was uninspired. Under-seasoned, disappointingly dull and it was a rather immoderately priced dish, at a pound per minute for the wait for it to arrive. Being next to borough market I was also surprised that such a pitiful selection of vegetable sides were available too. I could barely hear myself think about what to have for pudding over the din. I had come around to almost liking this place, but our sweet was forgotten. The waiter just bounded over to take our coffee order. I took my dinner date already sweet enough for coffee and more hot desking elsewhere.  Corporate, stuffy and overpriced.

65HmrzJ6BYyWGcr4DXrSag.text: This is THE SPOT for simple, delicious seafood. We didn't have a reservation but they were able to seat us immediately on a Friday evening. We ordered Japanese dressed oysters, Rockefeller dressed oysters and the full seafood platter (feeds 2 as a meal, 3-4 as a starter). The platters come in smaller and larger sizes, as well.The Rockefeller oysters were dressed with spinach, cheese and breadcrumbs. The toppings masked the oyster flavor. The Japanese oysters were lighter, topped only with ginger, soy sauce and wasabi. It basically tasted like sushi but with a slimey texture. This one definitely retained more of the oyster flavor. Interesting to try, but I'd recommend just sticking with naked seafood.The best part was the platter - and it was HUGE. Seafood usually isn't filling for us but this left us stuffed. The platter came with 6 oysters, a dressed crab, 3 baby lobsters and piles of clams, escargot, mussels, and shrimp. We were sitting at the bar, and the man shucking oysters snuck us 2 more oysters.The oysters were good, but nothing spectacular. My favorites were the baby lobsters, escargot and mussels. The lobster was difficult to open but the meat was so sweet! The mussels were cooked perfectly - not chewey but not too soft. And the escargot was just fun to pick out of the shell and eat. The shrimp was average tasting, tedious and slightly annoying to peel. Clams were very small. The crab, which included the head and legs, were dressed with cheese and chives. It was okay to me but my boyfriend LOVED it. The platter was £64 but definitely worth it considering the amount of seafood you're getting.I want to go back to Wright Brothers but my wallet is telling me "no."

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Full seafood platter
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Rockefeller dressed oysters (covered in green toppings) and Japanese dressed oysters

0PFBWGnukR-nq0kAHi3j9Q.text: Fabulous seafood restaurant, superior service , great decor & broad menu , great oysters et al

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

zmaVPIIv6pFNlMdL6mLxRw.text: This was lovely. Fresh crisp oysters with the best mignonette I have had ever, perfectly cooked scallops atop puréed pumpkin tufts and saviey fish soup.Great pairings of sparkling or still wines

SruG4ZluukRC01cub-k4gQ.text: When I saw the name of this restaurant, I decided to go before I even looked at the cuisine! I just wanted to introduce myself as Mr Wright and see what happened next. The hostess looked at me twice and apparently didn't know how to react. I was hoping to perhaps be treated like royalty but the stunned look would have to suffice. As an added bonus, the food and drinks were fresh and awesome!We ordered three kinds of oysters, raw, fried, and smoked and enjoyed them all! Well, the caviar didn't hurt either!The service was spot on also and we would look forward to returning, the next time we want seafood or I want to flummox a hostess.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Just Wright drink with black pepper infused vodka. Delicious!
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Raw oysters and caviar!
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Fried oysters!

8KV2BW3SOp7CAR3TU1HXGw.text: Excellent spot to grab some seafood next to the Borough Market. Worth going a little out of your way for. I've been a few times and it is what I imagine as an ideal oyster house and seafood spot.They present raw oysters beautifully and it tastes delicious with the right amount of brine. The fish pie (5/5) is a unique dish that I found mild but delicious. It has very hefty chunks of fish with a cream/potato top. Best fish pie I've hadGuinness beef and oyster pie (4/5) - hefty and filling. The oysters come raw and then you throw them in the pie to cook briefly. Brilliant! Scottish mackerel fillet on salad (3.5/5) - clean flavor and a refreshing salad. Pretty large portion actually. Not particularly memorable. It was a daily specialPrawns garlic and rockets (5/5) - great special. Wish it came back.Service is very friendly and attentive.

u3PwQqdx7hYrJ1Tq1zizEg.text: I do t give 5 stars often, because it makes me think the reviews works there or knows someone at location. This place though deserves it. Wait staff is attentive and Listens to your questions and great suggestions. The face that the meat pie had Teal huge chunks of meat all in it alone gives them props. The crust is flaky and light and the waitress suggested I slip the 2 oysters it came with into the slit at the top. Who knew? The flavor of the pie made it even more succulent and flavorful. Kinda want another one, but  already bursting....Ps the crispy bay prawns are delish too!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Beef pie with oysters

m3BJ9L3AZcfhG5omhvj9gQ.text: Rude rude rude! Expensive and mediocre. How can they charge $50 for a dozen oysters and still be in business. Waitress asked us to get out of our seats and stand at the bar as we had only ordered beers and was questioning if it was worth eating. Gf ordered 6 oysters, and without horseradish it was hard to enjoy the raw fattish taste.

ZCCfRLM5C0Hm3iLeXLBBjg.text: Was seating in front of the menu. It is not cheap to taste tge seafood here. We tried to follow the menu on board , ordered the starters, a selection of tiny 6pcs of oysters cost £18. We have fish soup and atlantic prawn as starter. Main dishes we have fish pie and cold crab with side dish new potato. Fish pie the portion is big but no as tasty as i would expected...with lot of fish bones hidden that make me go to toilet to throw out from my throat. Otherwise i could be choking and ended up in hospital. We skip the dessert as we cant download anymore foods. The bill come to nearly £100 with 12.5 percent service charge. I could have go to place like Whitstable that serve cheaper seafoods.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

8XRbVKkMJ-sR3a0Q4P--5w.text: Delicious! We had wonderful fried oysters, "New Orleans" style. Irish coffee martini wonder as is the Riesling. We ordered mussels and the scallops and were then told they ran out of mussels.  To our delight, when our order arrived, so did a large order of the most delicious mussels. The staff is friendly and attentive. Don't miss this place in the crowd of the Borough Market!

hnxkdJbuav_WocuT1WEnbQ.text: Had a disappointing meal, for a place that does charge a premium for its seafood.Oyster Happy hour - oysters for £1 between 3 to 5pm daily, however its an oyster that is not on their menu. I think it a Jersey Rock oyster. It was incredibly salty and mineral, not to my taste, it might be yours. But the waiter didn't even know what it was - I had to find out from the oyster shucker at the bar.Service - had to make a huge effort to flag down the waiting staff every time. They should be scanning the room instead of eyes down all the time. When our crab came, they forgot to bring the hand wash bowls until we asked. Pretty standard service stuff that isn't being done.Confusing pricing - the crab was £19 on the menu. When the bill came, it was £24. When queried, we were told that it costs more if it comes roasted and with a side of chips. We weren't told that at all when ordering, which was very poor service.Food - happy hour oysters were not very good. Even at £1, I think I'd prefer to not have them! The crab was really good though - succulent meat, with a nice butter sauce.Overall, I think I wouldn't go back again. It seems that Wright Brothers is now riding on its reputation, and the London seafood scene is very competitive with very good alternatives.

NqHQ4Pfb8kBzeAzWNN1FfA.text: Only came here for the oysters at the bar.  Quite decent and fresh.  Nothing to shout about and tourist price.  Probably will come back again for something else.  Great atmostphere rustic look.  A lot of nearby office workers come here for wine / beer with seafood after work.  Come during off peak time mid afternoon if you want to avoid the crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

iGtoa0cy0M3kmEr-TRB8bQ.text: Had SUCH an amazing time! I stopped in for dinner on my last night in London, and was treated to great service, great food, great atmosphere! The staff really were engaged and having fun with a full house of patrons. They were personable, which really made eating there very special.Definitely try the oysters, and rely on the staff for recommendations about what is in season, tasty and excellent. The menu has great surprises, so mix it up tapas style and just enjoy. Thanks again to Roberto and all the folks who made my last night in London one to remember!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. The beef and yellowtail were so fresh and so tasty!
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Amazing oysters!
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

_P6keOqHTTjsoxL6IxUOkg.text: The best in seafood! Loved sitting at the bar watching the guys cook the food. Delicious and simple seasonings! Can't wait to return! We tried multiple dishes and then dessert with an Irish coffee. Great way to spend the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Irish coffee!

aLkscqsNVRQW2jVTpaTq_Q.text: The food here is so good, we went twice in one week. There was a John Dory in a pesto-like sauce that was mind-blowing. We asked the really sweet waitress to suggest a lot of stuff for us, all of which was fantastic.

S7yYlkzkip-iS-r3GUVunA.text: We wanted seafood and this place popped up on yelp. Looked decent enough, so we gave it a go. Best decision ever! They were packed to the gills, but managed to squeeze our party of four in the back by the oyster bar. We ordered an array of appetizers and the fish pie. To start, the fish pie was recommended by our server. He literally said we are known for our fish pie, so we had to get it. It was heavenly. Sort of like a shepherd's pie with three types of fish as the base. We had two types of white fish (firm and buttery) and salmon (silky and rich). The fish was covered with pillowy mashed potatoes and broiled to a Golden brown on top. We also ordered the welks. These by far we a surprise for appearance. I never had welks before and they were by far my personal favorite. I ate the whole bowl. The sea smalls were steamed and served with an aioli. They tasted of the sea! Briny and sweet! We also had the fried kippers and the calamari. Both good, but not extraordinary. I wish I would have just ordered more bowls of the welks :/.

oaWWtzM5KJk-8eC4HuEh0g.text: Really good fresh oysters, had the Irish native oysters from Clarinbridge, lovely, the waiter gave us two jersey oysters to try as a contrast, nice gesture.We shared a brown Dorset crab which was super tasty, and we were given a very useful master class on how to extract the meat from the main body, really helpful. We were treated to a tour of the tanks downstairs, amazing, all the shellfish is alive on site, very interesting.Well worth a visit, great fish, great shellfish and attentive knowledgable staff. And beside my office, my new local!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. The oyster room downstairs

hTST6reeKXBnGzHVgx2tuw.text: Amazing food in a fantastic location. We came for dinner as a whole lab (there are 15 of us, and we took up over half of the tiny restaurant!) but the service was top notch, the wine and cocktail menus were extensive and the choice of sea food to dye for! FYI, There's ONE veggie starter option and ONE non-fish main (which was steak) the rest is straight out of the sea! But as it was our boss's choice of eatery, we were fully expecting a sea food restaurant as he is very passionate about his fish..and his verdict was, I quote, "superb!" He had oysters which I sampled and have to say they weren't half bad, sea bream and fried mixed sea food. I had the roasted cod because they'd run out of chilli crab, much to my disappointment. However the cod was a fantastic alternative, I'm suitably stuffed and the staff were loads of fun! Slightly pricey, but you get what you pay for!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Fried mixed sea food
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Oysters
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Roast cod, cabbage and mustard

dj9NhxiT4Yj4dtXlSDuEeA.text: Amazing fish in an incredible location of Borrough Market. You can literally taste the heritage of this cozy little fish purveyor. From the exposed brick to the oyster stands built in the the hardwood counter to the blackboards with the dust of a thousands daily specials -- the atmosphere is just the first course. A simple wine list and daily specials of fresh caught oyster (some dozen varieties) and uniquely prepared fish await. We came for a leisurely business lunch and split a carafe of Sauvignon Blanc and eat had the fish pie.  What a treat. A whole filet of salmon and another of smoked haddock nestled in cream and topped with crispy mashed potatoes. The perfectly lunch for a late Autumn day in London. Stop by and get one of London's best kept secrets on your hook!

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom

HqIprrGeOM4bK8xpJ0FZQw.text: This place is fantastic! Be prepared to book or wait though as its very popular, especially on a Saturday when the market is its busiest. Obviously went for the oysters and a lovely white wine! Rockefeller, New Orleans and Spanish were our choices and all were absolutely mind blowing. Enjoyed the baked, roasted and raw textures, even non oyster lovers wolfed them down! Not cheap but we'll work a special visit. Service friendly and attentive without being overbearing.

photos.caption: Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Spanish Oysters
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Rockefeller and New Orleans oysters
Photo of Wright Brothers - London, United Kingdom. Bar area

zavFf53lOU-HMYR-iUYp_g.text: What a terrific place!  Had a solo Friday lunch at the counter before walking to a meeting across the river in the City.  FIrst off, the people working there are lovely, from the guy at the desk to the servers.   The menu is seafood heaven.  If you have never had seafood in the British Isles, by all means try this place.  Although the plateaus of cold shellfish looked wonderful, as I was dining alone, I chose more practical options.  I started with a terrine of smoked mackerel recommended by my lovely server.  Wow, what great flavor!  What fresh fish!  Even the toasted bread with which it was served was terrific, crunchy and crusty.  The fresh lemon was a nice foil for the rich fish.I then had a dressed Cornish crab (I posted a picture).  If you love really fresh, sweet crab, this is for you IF you also love the roe, which is the dark stuff in the picture.  I thought it was quite rich and wonderful, but it is probably not for everyone.  A delicious mayonnaise made in-house was served along side it.  I used it sparingly on the flaky, perfectly cooked and wondrously fresh crabmeat., which is packed with the roe into the body cavity of the crab.This place is not inexpensive, but you really do get what you pay for in this case.  The people sitting next to me devoured s large platter of oysters and they looked pretty blissed out when finished, too.
